Column 2 lists the DHS survey round years. Column 3 indicates the birth years included in our sample matched in time and place to weather variables. These years extend backwards from the survey date, as mothers are reporting on their birth histories. Column 4 reports our DHS-based calculation of mean IMR in the sample, by country. Column 5 describes the completeness and quality of national mortality registration data (from Mathers et al., 2005) as a point of contrast. Data on the US and EU crude mortality rates come from the World Bank: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.DYN.CDRT.IN.
